result.title: Solution to Defective Rounds
result.content:
Well, once again the CF community has experienced a not so pleasant round, due to misleading statements, rubik's cube problems and hacking inflation. In order to minimize these human fails, I propose an approach similar to the free software contribution: a day before the round, the problems infos (statements, IOs, constraints etc) are released to the community as a whole, so more people can track down these annoying tiny details that ruin our rounds! Upon a mistake, the user who found it should post a comment in the blog pointing it out, so our coordinators can fix this. Then, the round should probably be good to go!

What do you think about this idea?!
